trustfund:
TF026895-RECOVERY AND REHABILITATION PROGRAM,TF023803-SJF-JAPAN-ERITREA RECOVERY
            & RECONSTRUCTION,TF024315-RECOVERY & REHAB. PROG. FOR ERITREA/RRPE,TF020296-ECONOMIC AND FINANCIAL
            MANAGEMENT PROGRAM (EFMP),TF024245-RECOVERY & REHAB. PROGRAM
            FOR ERITREA,TF029567-PHRD-ECONOMIC RECOVERY CREDIT

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Recovery and
            Rehabilitation Project for Eritrea were as follows: Bank
            performance was satisfactory; and Borrower performance was
            satisfactory. Some lessons learned included: there is need
            for greater flexibility in International Development
            Association (IDA) procurement and disbursement procedures.
            These are intended to ensure that IDA resources are
            effectively used for the designated purposes; the emphasis
            is on accountability, not speed of implementation. In
            multi-donor projects of this nature, the responsibilities in
            donor coordination of the government and IDA or any other
            key donor should be clearly defined at the outset. The
            economic and financial management program (EFMP) tried to
            accomplish too much and overestimated the receptivity and
            absorptive capacity of the Government of the State of
            Eritrea (GOE) with regard to technical assistance.
